short_description: glatzova is a legal services company based in hlavní město praha, czechia.
long_description: with 30 years of stable, organic growth driving us, we've established ourselves as one of the top independent law firms in the czech republic and slovakia , and one of the oldest law firms in the czech republic. in recognition of our high standards, we've received numerous awards from prestigious international and domestic rating agencies and have been repeatedly named the best law firm in the czech republic. we're not a legal factory; quantity is never our goal. instead, everything we produce is efficiently focused on solving each client's unique legal challenges. we don't measure our success by numbers, but rather by the satisfaction of our clients, who come to us to resolve their most complicated issues, handle their most demanding transactions and bring their most critical disputes to satisfying conclusions. with our in-depth knowledge of the law, our sensitive approach to our clients' business matters and our positive attitude to solving their legal challenges, our clients can always expect to get exactly what they need when they need it.
generated_description: glatzova, legally known as glatzová & co., ltd., is an independent law firm based in hlavní město praha, prague, operating in the czech and slovak republics. established over 30 years ago, it is one of the oldest law firms in the czech republic and a leading player in the legal services market. the firm specializes in areas such as mergers and acquisitions, banking and finance, real estate, dispute resolution, restructuring and insolvency, competition, labor and employment, intellectual property, energy, and general legal services. glatzová & co. is recognized for its high standards and has received numerous awards from international and domestic rating agencies. the firm is a member of several chambers of commerce and business associations, including the international chamber of commerce and the czech-german chamber of industry and commerce.
